private_information: I hold disks from top to bottom: A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H where A is the smallest and H is the largest.
left_peg.goal: Move all disks from the left peg to the right peg following the Tower of Hanoi rules.

middle_peg.goal: Move all disks from the left peg to the right peg following the Tower of Hanoi rules.

right_peg.goal: Move all disks from the left peg to the right peg following the Tower of Hanoi rules.

orchestrator.goal: Coordinate the agents and produce a complete PDDL domain and problem that solves the Tower of Hanoi instance, targeting the FastDownwards solver.

init.ordering: A is smallest, H is largest

public_information: There are three pegs named left, middle, and right.
There are 8 disks labeled A (smallest) through H (largest).
Only one disk may be moved at a time.
A larger disk may never be placed on top of a smaller disk.
Initial configuration: left peg holds A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H from top to bottom; middle and right pegs are empty.
Goal configuration: right peg holds A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H from top to bottom; left and middle pegs are empty.

report.system_prompt: You are the agent responsible for the left peg in a Tower of Hanoi instance. Provide a concise report of your local state, including the list of disks you hold from top to bottom, which disk is at the top if any, and which immediate legal moves are available from your peg given the global rules. Do not produce PDDL.
report.prompt: Your name is left_peg. Use your private information and the public environment facts to describe your local state and immediate legal moves succinctly.

report.system_prompt: You are the agent responsible for the middle peg in a Tower of Hanoi instance. Provide a concise report of your local state, including the list of disks you hold from top to bottom (if any), which disk is at the top if any, and which immediate legal moves are available from your peg given the global rules. Do not produce PDDL.
report.prompt: Your name is middle_peg. Use your private information and the public environment facts to describe your local state and immediate legal moves succinctly.

report.system_prompt: You are the agent responsible for the right peg in a Tower of Hanoi instance. Provide a concise report of your local state, including the list of disks you hold from top to bottom (if any), which disk is at the top if any, and which immediate legal moves are available from your peg given the global rules. Do not produce PDDL.
report.prompt: Your name is right_peg. Use your private information and the public environment facts to describe your local state and immediate legal moves succinctly.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent planning and PDDL modeling. Your task is to integrate the local reports from the peg agents and produce a complete and correct PDDL domain and PDDL problem encoding the 8-disk Tower of Hanoi instance. The produced PDDL must be suitable for the FastDownwards solver. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Ensure the domain models legal moves, enforces the rule that a larger disk cannot be placed on a smaller disk, and accurately reflects the initial and goal configurations. Keep agent-specific actions distinct only if necessary to preserve semantics, otherwise a single action model for moving a top disk between pegs is acceptable.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. Integrate the reports from the three peg agents and produce a PDDL domain and PDDL problem that implements the global goal: move all disks from left to right under Tower of Hanoi constraints. Target FastDownwards and ensure the PDDL is complete and unambiguous. Enclose the domain in <domain></domain> and the problem in <problem></problem>.
